Notes: Eskom legacy coal regulated; thermal IPPs under PPAs; limited merchant.
RegimeEvidenceNote: NERSA-approved Eskom tariff booklet; regulated cost-of-service for legacy fleet.

Notes: SOE-dominant; IPP PPAs for additions; no real merchant spot.
State-owned fossil generation under regulated tariffs.
ZESCO cost-of-service; selective IPP PPAs.
IPP PPAs (incl. export) + regulated domestic SOE assets.
Thermal IPPs under PPAs; KenGen/KPLC regulated; no merchant.
RegimeEvidenceNote: IPP PPAs with KPLC; KenGen regulated—policy docs available from ministry site.

Notes: NBET-backed PPAs (capacity + energy), gas pass-through.
RegimeEvidenceNote: NBET form PPA shows capacity and energy payments to IPPs.

Notes: Thermal IPPs with take-or-pay tolling/availability PPAs.
RegimeEvidenceNote: Case study documents take-or-pay PPAs with capacity & energy charges.

Notes: Azito/CIPREL IPPs under long-term PPAs.
RegimeEvidenceNote: Azito IPP under long-term PPA; confirms PPA regime.

Notes: Thermal IPPs under PPAs with SENELEC.
RegimeEvidenceNote: SENELEC as buyer; IPPs under PPAs (project docs on SENELEC site).

Notes: Concessions/IPPs sell under PPAs.
SOE cost-of-service; limited IPP program.
SOE regulated fleet; private IPPs under PPAs; exchanges provide limited merchant.
RegimeEvidenceNote: CERC Annual Report FY23–24 shows short-term/exchanges are a small share; bulk under PPAs/regulated.

Notes: IPP PPAs with capacity payments, take-or-pay, fuel pass-through.
RegimeEvidenceNote: Power Generation Policy 2015: two-part tariff (Capacity + Energy), take-or-pay for IPPs.

Notes: CCGT/HFO IPPs under availability PPAs; sovereign support.
CEB-owned thermal regulated; IPP PPAs for some plants.
IPPs sell to PLN under availability PPAs; PLN fleet regulated.
RegimeEvidenceNote: PLN IPP guide explains PPA framework with availability/capacity features.

Notes: Thermal BOT/IPP PPAs with EVN; EVN plants effectively regulated.
RegimeEvidenceNote: World Bank sample BOT PPA with EVN (capacity + energy structure).

Notes: Gas IPPs/SPPs under EGAT PPAs (availability).
RegimeEvidenceNote: EGAT explains IPP model with Availability Payment and Energy Payment.

Notes: Gas/coal IPPs under PPAs to TNB/SESB.
RegimeEvidenceNote: IPP PPAs with TNB include availability/capacity elements (source to be added).

Notes: WESM spot exists; many thermal units have PSAs; some merchant exposure.
RegimeEvidenceNote: Official WESM rules/manuals establish the spot market; many plants also have PSAs.

Notes: Tolling/availability PPAs with NEPCO.
RegimeEvidenceNote: EBRD report notes NEPCO PPAs with capacity and energy payments.

Notes: IPP/IWPP availability PPAs; EEHC-owned plants regulated.
RegimeEvidenceNote: Describes BOO/IPP schemes with PPAs alongside SOE dominance.

Notes: Thermal IPPs under long-term PPAs with ONEE.
RegimeEvidenceNote: States ONEE as single buyer purchasing from IPPs under PPAs.

Notes: IPP/PPP availability PPAs; SOE assets effectively regulated.
RegimeEvidenceNote: IPP/PPP projects with long-term availability-based PPAs (official framework).

Notes: IWPPs with capacity payments; SOE cost-of-service elements.
RegimeEvidenceNote: IWPP model in Abu Dhabi with availability payments (water & power).

Notes: IWPP availability PPAs; state support; regulated SOE elements.
IWPPs under availability PPAs.
IWPP/IPP program; SOE generation regulated.
Auctioned contracts dominate; ACL free market enables merchant/C&I exposure.
RegimeEvidenceNote: Explains dual environments: ACR (auctioned PPAs) and ACL (free market).

Notes: Auction PPAs + liquid spot; capacity payments; merchant exposure for some units.
RegimeEvidenceNote: Chile's contracting + capacity payment framework; liquid spot settlement.

Notes: Spot + bilaterals; Firm Energy Obligations (capacity) top-up.
RegimeEvidenceNote: CREG framework including Reliability Charge (Firm Energy Obligations).

Notes: Legacy CFE cost-of-service + IPP PPAs; WEM (policy shifts) allowed merchant exposure.
RegimeEvidenceNote: CENACE MEM pages/manuals (wholesale market operation).

Notes: MEM spot + CAMMESA-admin contracts; cost-plus/administrative elements prevalent.
Spot + bilaterals; capacity mechanism for selected plants.
RegimeEvidenceNote: EPIAŞ official pages for Day-Ahead/Intraday confirm functioning spot (merchant exposure).

Notes: Current conditions atypical; historically cost-plus elements.
Capacity remuneration + admin pricing; day-ahead exists but generation largely regulated.
New BOO CCGTs under sovereign-backed availability PPAs; SOE fleet regulated.
RegimeEvidenceNote: Recent BOO CCGTs under sovereign-backed availability PPAs.
